channel.title: Server distro
channel.description:
I'm using ubuntu to host apache, mysql, cups, samba, ftp, ssh and run some Java apps. Stuff's starting to go wrong with ubuntu so rather than reinstall it I think it's about time for a more apt distro. Obviously it's a server so I only need terminal and SSH access, but I'm still a retard so don't want anything too complicated.
Any suggestions for a decent distro to use?

item.title: Server distro
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Google some of the errors you get when you log in, id bet you fix them quickly. You probably have some files owned by root you can’t delete when you log in, this happens to me sometimes when I forward X through ssh. The samba error sounds like it could be a bad conf file.

I’ve tried and more often than not I end up making the problem even worse. A fresh start would be much easier. The samba error is strange because I can start it manually by typing sudo /etc/init.d/samba start.

item.title: Server distro
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

To be honest, my ftp server hardly ever works and if I fix it as soon as I get round to needing it, it’s broken again. I just use SSH, yes.

When I boot the server it just dies when loading the samba daemon, so everything after it doesn’t run. Also, when I login using the gdm I get loads of errors about the home directory and a “HAL Error” notification on the top bar. The internet also ceases to work when logged in, although the webserver still functions normally so… shrugs. There’s loads of little things like that which are annoying, I’m just making do for the moment.

Do you recommend upgrading to the new edition of ubuntu server?
